page.title: 04Luddington Village Hall
page.content: A committee was formed to raise funds for a new hall on July 10th 1978. The meeting was held in the old hall. Money in the bank at that time was about Â£12, by August 22nd 1979 this had risen to Â£2,212 due to fund raising efforts by villagers and others too numerous to mention. The old hall was demolished in June 1979. Financial assisstance was applied for and granted in 1984. The estimated cost was Â£33,000 half of this to come from Humberside County Council, 15% from Boothferry District Council, 25% from the Village Hall Committee and 10% from the Parish Council. A builder from Eastoft was voted by the Hall committee to begin work on July 13th 1984. The work was completted and the new Hall opened on March 16th 1985 by a member of Boothferry District Council.
